data.message: Thanks for this possibility of getting in touch. Its cool :) I have an issue and wrote you a message yesterday...and I'm just wondering if you reply to messages?

replies.message: Hi Sheila. This is a great place for asking questions, what can we help you with? -Elizabeth

wow. that is fast. I guess u could say its personal. I have fb page linked to my work. I'm not that knowlegable about fb pages so it was only recently I noticed people could 'score' you on the page. My first score was one measly star by someone who was not a client. Her aunt approached me to press her neice's wedding bouquet. A pink affair where, in my job thats a colour that alters hugely. I advised aunt. She gave me the go ahead on a particular shade (I touch up pinks). When it was collected the neice said it was a disaster. I offered to alter the colour at no cost. Not that I had any obligation to since I had faithfully followed the aunts instructions. Neice left premises saying she wasnt interested in alteration. Then I see the nasty one star. I love my work and work hard to maintain a high level of client satisfaction. T
Erm, sorry, its probably not that obvious. What I would like is to cancel the neice's review. Is that possible?

Thanks for reaching out, Sheila. You can follow these instructions to report a review that doesn't follow Community Standards or focus on the product or service offered by the Page: http://bit.ly/2fpm2Z1. Please keep in mind that you can only report star ratings that include reviews. -Joe
Facebook, some fan pages of visitors posted, can comment but can not see posted text. why？
